title: How does an analytical mind function? - Quora

response.answer_text: An analytical mind has a natural tendency to fixate on things, swiftly breaking broader ideas down into their fundamental ones, allowing one to consider how said ideas relates to other ideas, and how one idea may be influenced by another-its a mental lab, floating on some plane of consciousness, allowing you to examine the idea within a vacuum or in the presence of other variables-allowing you to pragmatically consider how the idea behaves. Its an important framework to develop, and can be developed if the right conditions are set upon its creation (the right questions).

Logicians have analytical mind. It is like looking at a glass with half water. They will argue for half filled or half empty. They will generate two options but cannot settle on either of them. To find the reason which is not real is analysis. Staying away from such minds will give peace to one.
It functions the same way any normal mind functions. The person may be educated or not, but they simply have learned through the years that being analytical works better for their life than not.
